com.vmware.cis.tagging

Interface Tag

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, Service, TagTypes
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TagStub

    public interface Tag
extends Service, TagTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Tag interface provides methods to create, read, update, delete, and enumerate tags.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        Tag.CreateInvocation create(TagTypes.CreateSpec createSpec)
        Creates a tag. To invoke this method, you need the create tag privilege on the input category.

        Invocation Result:
        The identifier of the created tag. The return value will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.

        Operation Errors:
        AlreadyExists - if the TagTypes.CreateSpec.getName() provided in the createSpec is the name of an already existing tag in the input category.
        InvalidArgument - if any of the input information in the createSpec is invalid.
        NotFound - if the category for in the given createSpec does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have the privilege to create tag.

        Parameters:
        createSpec - Specification for the new tag to be created.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.CreateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described create operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • get

        Tag.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String tagId)
        Fetches the tag information for the given tag identifier. To invoke this method, you need the read privilege on the tag in order to view the tag info.

        Invocation Result:
        The TagModel that corresponds to tagId.

        Operation Errors:
        NotFound - if the tag for the given tagId does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have the privilege to read the tag.

        Parameters:
        tagId - The identifier of the input tag. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • update

        Tag.UpdateInvocation update(java.lang.String tagId,
                            TagTypes.UpdateSpec updateSpec)
        Updates an existing tag. To invoke this method, you need the edit privilege on the tag.

        Operation Errors:
        AlreadyExists - if the TagTypes.UpdateSpec.getName() provided in the updateSpec is the name of an already existing tag in the same category.
        InvalidArgument - if any of the input information in the updateSpec is invalid.
        NotFound - if the tag for the given tagId does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have the privilege to update the tag.

        Parameters:
        tagId - The identifier of the input tag. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.
        updateSpec - Specification to update the tag.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.UpdateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described update operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • delete

        Tag.DeleteInvocation delete(java.lang.String tagId)
        Deletes an existing tag. To invoke this method, you need the delete privilege on the tag.

        Operation Errors:
        NotFound - if the tag for the given tagId does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have the privilege to delete the tag.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.

        Parameters:
        tagId - The identifier of the input tag. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.DeleteInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described delete operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • list

        Tag.ListInvocation list()
        Enumerates the tags in the system. To invoke this method, you need read privilege on the individual tags. The List will only contain tags for which you have read privileges.

        Invocation Result:
        The List of resource identifiers for the tags in the system. The return value will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.

        Returns:
        instance of Tag.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • listUsedTags

        Tag.ListUsedTagsInvocation listUsedTags(java.lang.String usedByEntity)
        Enumerates all tags for which the usedByEntity is part of the TagModel.getUsedBy() subscribers Set. To invoke this method, you need the read privilege on the individual tags.

        Invocation Result:
        The List of resource identifiers for the tags in the system that are used by usedByEntity. The return value will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.

        Parameters:
        usedByEntity - The field on which the results will be filtered.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.ListUsedTagsInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described listUsedTags operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • listTagsForCategory

        Tag.ListTagsForCategoryInvocation listTagsForCategory(java.lang.String categoryId)
        Enumerates all tags for the given category. To invoke this method, you need the read privilege on the given category and the individual tags in that category.

        Invocation Result:
        The List of resource identifiers for the tags in the given input category. The return value will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.

        Operation Errors:
        NotFound - if the category for the given categoryId does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have the privilege to read the category.

        Parameters:
        categoryId - The identifier of the input category. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Category.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.ListTagsForCategoryInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described listTagsForCategory operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • addToUsedBy

        Tag.AddToUsedByInvocation addToUsedBy(java.lang.String tagId,
                                      java.lang.String usedByEntity)
        Adds the usedByEntity to the TagModel.getUsedBy() subscribers Set. If the usedByEntity is already in the Set, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this method, you need the modify TagModel.getUsedBy() privilege on the tag.

        Operation Errors:
        NotFound - if the tag for the given tagId does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have the privilege to add an entity to the TagModel.getUsedBy() field.

        Parameters:
        tagId - The identifier of the input tag. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.
        usedByEntity - The name of the user to be added to the TagModel.getUsedBy() Set.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.AddToUsedByInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described addToUsedBy operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • removeFromUsedBy

        Tag.RemoveFromUsedByInvocation removeFromUsedBy(java.lang.String tagId,
                                                java.lang.String usedByEntity)
        Removes the usedByEntity from the TagModel.getUsedBy() subscribers set. If the usedByEntity is not using this tag, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this method, you need modify TagModel.getUsedBy() privilege on the tag.

        Operation Errors:
        NotFound - if the tag for the given tagId does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have the privilege to remove an entity from the TagModel.getUsedBy() field.

        Parameters:
        tagId - The identifier of the input tag. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.
        usedByEntity - The name of the user to be removed from the TagModel.getUsedBy() Set.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.RemoveFromUsedByInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described removeFromUsedBy operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • revokePropagatingPermissions

        Tag.RevokePropagatingPermissionsInvocation revokePropagatingPermissions(java.lang.String tagId)
        Revokes all propagating permissions on the given tag. You should then attach a direct permission with tagging privileges on the given tag. To invoke this method, you need tag related privileges (direct or propagating) on the concerned tag.

        Operation Errors:
        NotFound - if the tag for the given tagId does not exist in the system.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have the privilege to revoke propagating permissions on the tag.

        Parameters:
        tagId - The identifier of the input tag. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.
        Returns:
        instance of Tag.RevokePropagatingPermissionsInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described revokePropagatingPermissions operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
